review: "The Enchanted Castle and Five Children and It" is a charming collection of two classic children’s stories. While the imaginative elements and engaging plot of 'Five Children and It' initially captured my interest, the repetitive nature of the wishes and their consequences became somewhat predictable. 'The Enchanted Castle' offered a fresh start with its unique premise and invisible princess, but the pacing occasionally dragged, and the moralistic tone was a bit heavy-handed. Despite these drawbacks, the stories are still enjoyable and have a timeless quality that makes them worth reading, though they didn't quite hit the mark as strongly as I had hoped."
